data_structures.py¶

Contains the Params class and subclasses for specific file types.

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.CedarBatchParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for cedar batch files

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.DefaultParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for default parameters

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.LocalBatchParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for local machine batch files

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.MFDPParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for mfdp.dat files

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.ManParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for manual input

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.Params(filetype, **kwargs)¶

The Params class is pretty much just an argparse.Namespace, except you can only have certain variables.

For example, mfdp.dat files have a field for ZN, so a Params object for that file type should have an attribute self.ZN.

But if you tried to set self.Z by accident it should raise an error.

This prevents accidentally setting the wrong attributes for a file type, or too many parameters, or too few.

param_dict()¶

Returns a dictionary with the same info contained in the Params object

class ncsd_python.multi_modules.data_structures.SummitBatchParams(**kwargs)¶

Params subclass for summit batch files
